channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Moment professor wakes up his colleague at 2am to tell him they've won the Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: Stanford University professor Robert B. Wilson desperately rushed to the home of his colleague, Paul R. Milgrom, at 2am in California to wake him up with the news they won a Nobel Peace Prize

item.title: Boris Johnson's Covid Britain: pubs closed and families banned from mixing in worst-affected areas
item.description: In the Commons this afternoon Mr Johnson introduced the much-trailed Local Covid Alert Levels that will shut down pubs and bars and block people from visiting each other.

item.title: Police in parts of Britain are 80 TIMES more likely to hand out Covid fines than others
item.description: Police in Wales, Cumbria and North Yorkshire are handing out higher rates of Covid-19 fines than any other part Britain, as a lawyer warned Covid-19 rule enforcement should 'not depend on postcode'.

item.title: Coronavirus intensive care units are at breaking point as wards fill up
item.description: Critical care consultant at Blackpool's Victoria Hospital Dr Jason Cupitt said he is 'tired and worried' as he and all his collegues brace to re-live their coronavirus frontline roles 'all over again'.

item.title: Donald Trump complains to campaign staff there are not enough events on his schedule
item.description: A mask-free Donald Trump departed for Florida for his first campaign rally after his battle with COVID, where hundreds of supporters awaited him with few wearing face coverings.

item.title: Boris Johnson faces growing Tory rebellion over need to protect UK food standards
item.description: The Commons was due to vote on an amendment to the Agriculture Bill but ministers blocked this using a technicality last deployed ten years ago. Lord Curry of Kirkharle told the Mail: 'I won't let it go.'

item.title: Three million miss cancer checks: Charity chiefs warn of devastating impact on survival rates
item.description: Cancer Research UK (CRUK) found that millions have missed vital screenings while more than 350,000 people haven't been urgently referred for a cancer check who should have been.

item.title: Viewers comment on Boris Johnson's 'hair loss' during announcement
item.description: Boris Johnson appeared on television twice today - once to say 'deaths are already rising' and again to plunge millions of Britons deeper into coronavirus lockdown. Viewers claim they noticed his hair loss.

item.title: Liverpool landladies fear for survival of pubs as city enters lockdown
item.description: Bar owners in Liverpool have spoke of their devastation as the city became England's first 'tier three' Covid zone. Paula Smith (pictured), who runs The Dog House, told of her fears for her livelihood.

item.title: Channel 4 documentary claims E. Coli is found in 90% of US turkeys
item.description: About 13 per cent of pork samples tested for salmonella in US meat were positive for the bacteria, and E. coli, another potentially harmful bacterium, was also found in 80 per cent of chicken.

item.title: Families face an extra £125 a month in tax to cover annual £42bn hole
item.description: The Institute for Fiscal Studies has warned that borrowing due to the coronavirus pandemic is already set to hit levels not seen outside of the two world wars.

item.title: Harvard timelapse map reveals how 'untamed' covid spread in the US
item.description: As broad a swath of the US as ever is now in the red as high-risk for COVID-19 spread, with more than 25 people per 100,000 residents testing positive each day in 11 states, the new animation reveals.
item.media:credit: GlobalEpidemics.org/Microsoft AI for Health, Brown School of Public Health, Harvard Edmond J. Safra Center for Ethics

item.title: Amazon Prime Day: FEMAIL reveals the best deals from the retailer and its high street rivals
item.description: The annual global shopping extravaganza usually takes place in July, but was postponed to October 13-14 this year due to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Expert has 'proof' that Admiral Horatio Nelson did NOT support slavery
item.description: A letter claiming to show Admiral Horatio Nelson's support for slavery has been exposed as a forgery, cooked up by anti-abolitionists in a last-ditch effort to keep the trade alive.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 17m now under two higher tiers of lockdown
item.description: Unveiling his new 'Three Tier' system, Boris Johnson declared that the highest restrictions will mean pubs being shut and households banned from mixing altogether.

item.title: Forget the R rate, it's the Covid-19 clusters we need to stop
item.description: During the coronavirus pandemic, the reproduction number - R for short - has been used as a key measure of whether the virus is under control.

item.title: Sage experts say Test and Trace is having a 'marginal' impact on tackling the virus
item.description: The £12 billion programme will 'further decline' unless it grows at the same rate as the epidemic, the scientific advisory group warned in documents released on Monday.

item.title: Liverpool and Manchester United remain determined to go ahead with 'Project Big Picture'
item.description: Liverpool and Manchester United remain determined to bring about a radical restructure that would reduce the size of the Premier League despite fierce opposition from several parts of the game.

item.title: Nevada man, 25, contracted coronavirus twice in 48 days and was SICKER during his second bout
item.description: An unnamed 25-year-old man from Washoe County, Nevada, tested positive for the virus on April 18 after developing mild illness and again on June 5 after experiencing more severe symptoms.

item.title: STEPHEN GLOVER: How ironic if the people who helped get Boris Johnson elected now turn against him
item.description: STEPHEN GLOVER: To what degree will draconian new measures unveiled yesterday in the Commons by a pugnacious Boris Johnson destroy hope in the hearts of former Labour supporters?

item.title: Coronavirus: How a flu jab could also protect you from infection
item.description: The worry is many more lives will be lost if people catch flu and coronavirus together. A Public Health England study showed that the risk of death doubles if that happens.

item.title: Prince Charles addresses soldiers at top-secret US spy base RAF Menwith
item.description: Prince Charles did not let the rain dampen his spirits on a visit to RAF Menwith, North Yorkshire. He also went to Catterick Garrison, where he is pictured with troops from the Royal Dragoon Guards.

item.title: The remedies that can make your problem WORSE
item.description: When the Covid-19 pandemic first hit the UK, thousands turned to the trusty painkiller ibuprofen to combat symptoms such as headaches and fever.

item.title: Tom Parker's The Wanted pals rally round after terminal and inoperable brain tumour diagnosis
item.description: The singer, 32, who was a member of the boyband alongside Max, Jay, Nathan Sykes and Siva Kaneswaran from 2009 until 2014, was met with well wishes from his longtime friends.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Rishi Sunak gives £1.5bn to English councils
item.description: The free-spending Chancellor joined Boris Johnson at a live television news conference tonight as The PM warned that the UK cannot ignore the 'flashing warnings' about surging coronavirus cases.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: London saved from Tier Two lockdown...for now
item.description: Boris Johnson stepped back from immediately placing the capital into the second Very High risk group as he outlined the nation's new triple-tiered lockdown system this afternoon.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: When does a pub become a restaurant under new rules?
item.description: In legislation relating to areas in the 'very high' tier, clarity is given as to what constitutes a meal in a pub (pictured, in Liverpool) in England.

item.title: Hundreds of maskless shoppers force Brazil department store to close
item.description: This is the astonishing moment hundreds of shoppers rushed inside a new department store in Brazil ignoring social distancing guidelines.

item.title: Boy, 17, arrested for murder after Nottingham man stabbed to death
item.description: Nottinghamshire Police have arrested the teenager in Milton Street in the city centre in connection with the incident.

item.title: HENRY DEEDES watches the Prime Minister laying down more coronavirus rules and regulation
item.description: HENRY DEEDES: The PM had laid out the new restrictions in the Commons earlier in the afternoon. His statement was slow and solemn. Levity was in short supply.

item.title: Kamala Harris accuses Amy Coney Barrett of planning to undo Ruth Bader Ginsburg's legacy
item.description: Clashes ensued immediately as senators delivered their opening statements during the first day of Amy Coney Barrett's confirmation hearing for what's bound to be a controversial week.

item.title: RUTH SUNDERLAND: Disaster that left British Airways worth less than Just Eat
item.description: RUTH SUNDERLAND: Mr Cruz (pictured with the Queen last year) is paying the price for the pandemic - and for presiding over the most toxic period in British Airway's industrial relations in recent memory.

item.title: Elderly Covid patients are being admitted to hospital at EIGHT TIMES the rate of young people
item.description: Professor Stephen Powis (pictured), national medical director of NHS England, warned of steep rises among over-65s and an even faster acceleration among over-85s.

item.title: For nearly six months RAY CONNOLLY has been in hospital fighting Covid-19. Now he shares his story
item.description: RAY CONNOLLY: What passed through my mind during those months was so realistic that, for weeks after, I believed that the incidents I had been imagining were really happening.

item.title: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Driven by fear and dodgy science, this was bound to end in tiers
item.description: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: The so-called evidence wheeled out to justify the Government's latest 'Three Tier' lockdown policy was intended solely to silence sceptics and scare the public into submission.

item.title: Anger as billionaire Asda brothers head for Jersey tax haven
item.description: Under the deal struck by Mohsin, left, and Zuber, right, Issa, who were made CBEs in the Queen's Birthday Honours list, the grocer will be legally controlled by a parent company based in Jersey.

item.title: The Batman: Colin Farrell and Robert Pattison film in Liverpool
item.description: The Irish actor, 44, was worlds away from his usual chiselled handsome features as he wore heavy prosthetics and make-up on his face for the legendary DC Comics role.

item.title: Photos reveal jumbo jet graveyard where 16 planes wait to be scrapped
item.description: Aerial photographs of an airfield in Kemble, Gloucestershire, show a number of iconic jets, including 16 of British Airway's Boeing 747s, which were rendered inviable by coronavirus.

item.title: Two NCIS: New Orleans actors sue CBS after they were 'nearly killed' during filming of heist scene
item.description: The lawsuit, filed in Los Angeles, accuses CBS of orchestrating the 'guerilla-style' heist scene at a strip mall on West Judge Perez Drive in St. Bernard Parish October 2017 without taking precautions.

item.title: US Election 2020: Kanye West releases presidential campaign video
item.description: West - whose mental health battle has been well-documented in recent months - first posted the video on Twitter. He is now asking voters to write him in as a candidate when they cast their ballots.

item.title: Pre-orders for new iPhone 12, with 30x zoom camera, start 16 October
item.description: The latest leaks about Apple's new iPhone suggest the smartphone will have a 30x digital zoom camera capable of focusing in on objects and people three times farther than previous models.

item.title: Courts to come down harder with bans for motorists with 12 or more points
item.description: The Sentencing Council has published new Magistrates' Court sentencing guidelines to prevent motorists from claiming disqualification from driving will result in 'exceptional hardship'.

item.title: New 'wearable paint' PRINTED on the body monitors vital signs
item.description: Scientists at Penn State have developed a circuit made of metal 'paint' that is printed onto the body to monitor body temperature and other vital signs, then washed off when it was finished.

item.title: Meghan Markle to discuss 'courageous leadership' in yet another virtual summit
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex is due to take part in the Fortune's Most Powerful Women Next Gen Virtual Summit on Tuesday.

item.title: Oliver Dowden apologises for 'crass' ballerina retraining advert
item.description: He took to social media to distance the Government from an ad that featured a young dancer tying up her ballet pumps alongside the caption: 'Fatima's next job could be in cyber. (she just doesn't know it yet).'

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Professor Jonathan Van-Tam's numbers behind Boris Johnson's 'traffic light' lockdown
item.description: Deputy chief medical officer Jonathan Van-Tam and NHS medical director Stephen Powis told a No10 briefing the number of patients in hospital was now higher than before the blanket lockdown.

item.title: NHS trust tells patients they will have to wait up to TWO YEARS for non-urgent treatment
item.description: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS, which runs Castle Hill Hospital and Hull Royal Infirmary, has told thousands of patients they may have to wait up to two years for non-urgent treatment due to Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 13,972 new cases and 50 deaths as daily toll rises
item.description: It comes as Boris Johnson plunged millions of Brits deeper into coronavirus lockdown as he delivered a grim warning that the country is teetering on the brink again.

item.title: Brave five-year-old tries to fight off armed gunmen holding mom hostage after bursting into home
item.description: Surveillance video of the September 30 home invasion in South Bend, Indiana, shows David, five, hitting and throwing toys at armed gunmen as they pointed their guns at his mother, Tamika Reid.

item.title: Meghan Markle wanted to be the 'most famous person on the planet,' Lady Colin Campbell claims
item.description: Speaking on Graham Norton's morning show, Lady Colin Campbell, claimed Meghan Markle, 39, told her PR team that she wanted to be the 'most famous person on the planet.'

item.title: Childhood obesity may be caused by changes in the reward centre of the brain
item.description: Researchers from Yale University used a novel MRI technique to take a closer look at the microstructures of the brain to discover links between obesity and reward.

item.title: Family fight against Dubai ruler's Scottish Highlands estate plans
item.description: Roddy Macleod, 72, said the billionaire sheikh was on a 'hostile takeover' of the Loch Duich's shoreline, even though he had only visited the area five times in the last 30 years.

item.title: Birmingham shisha bar is fined £10,000 for flouting Covid rules after police find 250 crammed inside
item.description: Workers at Kasablanca Shisha Lounge in Birmingham can be seen trying to close the shutters on officers as they arrived at the premises on September 30.

item.title: Ford recalls thousands of plug-in hybrid Kuga SUVs over fire concerns
item.description: The petrol-electric hybrid Kugas were launched only in May and the recall affects 1,800 owners in the UK out of an estimated 27,000 globally.

item.title: James Bond-style takes shape as build enters final stage
item.description: A UK company has nearly completed construction on the world's most technically advanced 'surface-submersible', capable of operating both on and under the water.

item.title: Dominic West's wife 'devastated' as pictures emerge of him kissing Lily James
item.description: The actor, 50, and the Mamma Mia! star, 31, didn't seem to mind who saw them as they cuddled up to one another and shared a ride on an electric scooter while taking in the sights.

item.title: Moment massive brawl erupts at traffic lights as two gangs kick and smash each other's cars
item.description: The footage that was taken from a nearby building shows four cars coming to a standstill at a traffic light crossing outside Empire Cinemas in Hendon, Sunderland.

item.title: P&O takes delivery of its BIGGEST ever cruise-liner
item.description: The ship, which arrived at the Meyer Werft shipyard in Germany on Friday, was originally due for launch in May but this was delayed due to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Covid-19 infection rates at universities are up to SEVEN TIMES higher than in local cities
item.description: Sheffield University reported has an infection rate of 2,028 per 100,000 population. It's seven times higher than that for the city council area as a whole at almost 300.

item.title: City financier Amanda Staveley cuts £1.6billion Barclays damages claim by half
item.description: Amanda Staveley claims Barclays agreed to provide an unsecured £2 billion loan to Qatari investors - but says the loan was 'concealed' from PCP Capital Partners, a private equity firm she runs.

item.title: Britain's Got Talent is hit by 2,094 Ofcom complaints over Nabil Abdulrashid's performance
item.description: The funnyman, 35, divided viewers with his routine with some branding the performance 'too political' for a family show while others praised him for 'pushing boundaries'.

item.title: Catskills resort featured in hit series 'The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel' is for sale for $6million
item.description: Scott's Family Resort in Deposit, New York, which was featured in the hit show The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel, is up for sale for $6million.

item.title: Heartbreaking moment James Foley's mother breaks down over late son
item.description: James Foley's mother Diane appears in BBC2 documentary series The Face of Terror tonight and tears up as she admits she 'didn't know to advocate for him' while he was held by ISIS terrorists in Syria.

item.title: Police fine 32 Essex University students £200 for repeatedly flouting the 'Rule of Six'
item.description: The party was held at a house on Bowthorpe Road in Norwich before being broken up by officers from Norfolk Constabulary. Pictured: A file photo of the University of East Anglia.

item.title: Britain's oldest cat 'brothers' Nikita and Leon, aged 21, are rehomed after social media campaign
item.description: Black shorthair crossbreeds Nikita and Leon, who have been inseperable all their lives, were taken to the RSPCA in Northamptonshire.

item.title: Professor Jonathan Van-Tam: North of England never squashed Covid-19 outbreak properly
item.description: Official data shows two thirds of Covid-19 hospital admissions are in Yorkshire, the North East and North West, where swathes are expected to be hit with harsher Covid-19 rules today.

item.title: Ex-Blue Peter presenter John Leslie arrives for first day for sex assault trial
item.description: The alleged sexual assault is said to have taken place when former Blue Peter star John Leslie was at a party at a nightclub in London's West End in 2008, jurors at Southwark Crown Court were told.

item.title: Hundreds evacuated as Polish divers begin operation to defuse 12,000lb RAF 'Tallboy' bomb
item.description: The five-tonne device, nicknamed 'Tallboy' and also known as an 'earthquake bomb', was dropped by the Royal Air Force in an attack on a Nazi warship near Swinoujscie in 1945.

item.title: DIY novices spend £25,000 transforming their ugly 1930s semi-detached house into a colourful home
item.description: Clara McGillian, 31, and Nicholas Felstead, 35, from Bridgend, Wales, spent £25,000 transforming a 1930s semi-detached home after finding they were unable to afford a new build.

item.title: Father 'strangled his son, three, and stabbed his wife, 36, before killing himself weeks later'
item.description: Police believe Kuha Raj Sithamparanathan murdered his son Kailash Kuha Raj and his wife Poorna Kaameshwari Sivaraj before stabbing himself to death at their home in Brentford.

item.title: Restaurant explosion kills 19-year-old girl, injures eight teenage customers
item.description: A 19-year-old girl has died after an outdoor table heater exploded at a restaurant in Argentina.

item.title: Prince William would be 'perfect' for Captain General of Royal Marines' role, says Major General
item.description: Major General Julian Thompson spoke to The Express and told how the Royal Marines need 'someone who lives here.' for the role - before adding that Prince William would be 'perfect.'

item.title: Pictured: Pilot, 44, who died after his light aircraft plunged to earth in Lake District
item.description: 'Fantastic father' David Bolton, 44, was flying his aircraft at Troutbeck in Cumbria when it crashed just before 3pm on Sunday, October 11. He was tragically pronounced dead at the scene.

item.title: Oxford University confirms 61 Covid cases among staff and students
item.description: Oxford University (pictured) has now recorded 91 cases through 1,631 tests since it started checks on August 20.

item.title: More than a quarter of 'Gen Zers' are now teetotal
item.description: According to the data, a survey of 182,722 US young adults aged 18 - 22, alcohol abuse has also been slashed in half.

item.title: Human blood tastes 'salty and sweet' like caramel to mosquitoes, study says
item.description: US researchers have described our blood as being 'a little salty and a little sweet' to hungry mosquitoes, just like the hugely popular confectionery.

item.title: White 'Karen' hurls helpless dog at a black man during vile racist attack
item.description: In a shocking video, filmed by the victim, a woman holding a puppy is seen confronting a man in the middle of a what is believed to be an LA street empty street in broad daylight.

item.title: Doctor, 29, denies repeatedly groping a woman's breasts and bottom in a busy hospital A&E
item.description: Dr Kabir Sandhu, 29, is said to have sexually assaulted a woman in the A&E of St Mary's Hospital, London, on December 1 2018 and on five further occasions on January 2 last year.

item.title: Woman was left TOOTHLESS after her toothache turned out to be cancer
item.description: Nicole Kowalksi, 28, from Los Angeles, lost some of her top her teeth and can only open her mouth nine millimeters wide after being diagnosed with salivary gland cancer in 2018.

item.title: Job Support Scheme could save just 230,000 jobs, says think tank
item.description: They say that the schemes will only save the jobs of around 230,000 people whose earnings are in the 'goldilocks' corridor of between £625 and £987 per month and are in a 'viable job.'

item.title: Sheep farmer, 45, jailed for 14 years over bid to extort £1.4m from Tesco
item.description: Nigel Wright, 45, placed three jars of baby food laced with shards of metal in a bid to extort £1.4 million worth of Bitcoin from the supermarket chain.

item.title: Swedish police chiefs plead for more resources as migrant mafia gangs terrorise the country
item.description: They say that immigrant mafia clans from the Middle East, north Africa and the Balkans are behind the surging crime rates in the urban centres and suburbs, with 257 bombings last year.

item.title: Portugal: The nail-biting new see-through '516 Arouca' footbridge that hangs 575ft above a river
item.description: Named the 516 Arouca, the attraction connects the two sides of the Paiva Gorge - near Porto - and its designers have described the experience of walking along it as 'like walking on air'.

item.title: Sir Keir Starmer refuses to condemn Met Police over 'race hate' probe into journalist Darren Grimes
item.description: Labour leader Keir Starmer today refused to condemn the police investigation of a Brexit blogger - despite a freedom of speech backlash

item.title: Oxford professor is awarded his old university job back after winning age discrimination case
item.description: Professor Paul Ewart, former head of atomic and laser physics, had demanded to be given his old job of senior lecturer back after forced retirement.

item.title: Camilla visits Wiltshire Council to thank staff for their work during the Covid-19 outbreak
item.description: The Duchess of Cornwall, 73, who donned a floral face masks, visited Wiltshire Council to thank staff for their work during the Covid-19 outbreak today.

item.title: Shocking moment tractor driver rams hunt saboteurs in their pickup truck
item.description: West Kent Hunt Sabs campaigners were shunted by the vehicle, allegedly driven by a hunt supporter, on Saturday, with the incident captured on camera.

item.title: Covid-19: Worldwide airport passenger numbers plummeted 58% in the first half of 2020, says report
item.description: The figures have been revealed by Airports Council International in its new World Airport Traffic Report. It shows overall aircraft movements fell 41.6 per cent in the first half of 2020.

item.title: PC broke lover's neck 'forcing her out of car' after she threatened to tell wife about affair
item.description: Timothy Brehmer, 41, a constable with Dorset Police, strangled Claire Parry, 41, a nurse, with such force that he broke a bone in her neck before she died in hospital the next day, prosecutors said.

item.title: Security boss told police of man with 'bulging rucksack' filming Take That fans in Manchester Arena
item.description: Ex-police officer Jonathan Lavery said the man was seen filming in the foyer of the Manchester Arena ahead of a Take That concert on May 18, four days before the blast which killed 22 people.

item.title: Woman wins £300,000 cottage for a TENNER!
item.description: Janet Shepherd, 40, won the property - worth up to £300,000 - in the Llŷn Peninsula, Wales after purchasing two £5 tickets to a competition.

item.title: Jude Law, 47, is every inch the playful new dad as he makes faces at his newborn sixth child
item.description: Jude Law was every inch the playful new father as he was seen for the first time with his newborn baby during a stroll in London on Saturday,

item.title: Education Secretary Gavin Williamson confirms GCSE and A-Level exams WILL go ahead next summer
item.description: The Education Secretary also outlined plans to streamline some subjects saying it would 'support teachers and students by freeing up valuable teaching time'.

item.title: Sophie Toscan du Plantier murder: Ireland REJECTS extradition of British man to France
item.description: Ireland's High Court has rejected France's request to extradite Briton Ian Bailey over the murder of Sophie Toscan du Plantier, a French film director's wife found beaten to death in Cork in 1996.

item.title: Kate Middleton visits Natural History Museum and will announce Wildlife Photographer of the Year
item.description: The Duchess of Cambridge, 38, appeared elegant in a glamorous black suit during the visit to the Natural History Museum ahead of the virtual award ceremony tomorrow night.

item.title: Samurai sword killers who murdered family man got £17,000 legal aid for QCs to try reduce jail term
item.description: Depraved murderers of a father-of-two who tried to cut his head off with a samurai sword received over £17,000 of legal aid for expensive lawyers to fight for them in court

item.title: Birmingham's Clean Air Zone to go live on 1 June 2021
item.description: Drivers of older polluting petrol and diesel cars who travel into the centre of Birmingham will face daily charges of £8 from 1 June 2021, the new start date for the city's delayed Clean Air Zone.

item.title: Robots: Scientists invent a mechanical arm to perform colonoscopies in 'less painful' procedure
item.description: WARNING: GRAPHIC CONTENT The system - from a team led from Leeds - could prove to be the first major update in decades to the procedure, which is used some 100,000 times each year in the UK.

item.title: South Africa's President Ramaphosa rejects claims of 'ethnic cleansing'
item.description: President Cyril Ramaphosa's appeal on Monday came after a group of mainly white farmers stormed a courthouse on Wednesday during the hearing of two black suspects.

item.title: Lung cancer referrals are down 50% because symptoms are similar to Covid-19, experts claim
item.description: About 16,000 fewer patients than doctors would expect have been urgently referred for lung cancer tests in England since March, according to Cancer Research UK.

item.title: Two police officers face possible criminal charges over 'sex attack' at chief constable's party
item.description: Chief Superintendent Mark Warrender, pictured, head of CID, and his temporary assistant chief constable Marc Budden, were suspended after a complaint from a woman officer after the bash.

item.title: Mid-autumn cold snap will see UK temperatures plunge below 0C
item.description: Eastern parts of the UK faced rain showers today while Scotland will see winds of up to 50mph - and this week will bring maximum temperatures of only 14C (57F) for most of England with grey skies.

item.title: Sugar babies proudly flaunt their VERY expensive gifts on TikTok
item.description: A new trend sees sugar babies, from the US and Canada, flaunting their gifts, showing off the wads of cash they've received, and giving advice on how to 'hunt' an older man on TikTok.

item.title: Reality TV star Tory MP, 27, tells how sexist yobs hurled abuse at her
item.description: Bishop Auckland MP Dehenna Davison says she was told to 'get my t*** out' after she was recognised while walking home from the shops on Saturday.

item.title: Killer Jeremy Bamber in legal challenge as prison service refuses to move him from maximum security
item.description: Jeremy Bamber has always protested his innocence and claims his sister, who suffered from schizophrenia, shot her family before turning the gun on herself at White House Farm, Essex.

item.title: British Airways boss Alex Cruz is stepping down and will be replaced by Aer Lingus chief Sean Doyle
item.description: Alex Cruz, who was appointed BA chief in 2016, is to be replaced by Aer Lingus chief executive Sean Doyle but will stay on as non-executive chairman for a transition period.

item.title: Children in care homes did not report alleged sexual abuse by late Lord Janner, inquiry hears
item.description: Brian Altman QC, counsel to the Independent Inquiry into Child Sexual Abuse, said complainants allegedly abused by the late Lord Janner feared they 'would not be believed'.

item.title: Ordinary-looking home in Stockport that has its own heated swimming pool goes on sale for £395,000
item.description: The four-bedroom property in Brinnington is on one of Stockport's biggest housing estates and looks to be a standard 1960s redbrick build from the outside.

item.title: Prince Harry uses Trump-like political gestures to stress personal epiphany, says body language guru
item.description: Body language guru Judi James told FEMAIL Prince Harry used 'over-expansive and emphatic gesticulation that we would normally see from a politician' during Zoom chat with Oxford grad.

item.title: Mars will shine big and bright in the sky on Tuesday
item.description: Mars will be visible with the naked eye and appear slightly reddish in colour - looking through a telescope should allow you to spot surface features and polar ice caps.

item.title: Dentist reveals how much toothpaste you should REALLY put on a toothbrush
item.description: Dr. Gao Jye Teh, a graduate of King's College in London, has gone viral with a TikTok video about toothpaste. He says anyone over age three just needs a pea-sized amount.

item.title: Davina McCall says menopause reminded her of when she abused drugs
item.description: Talking to Loose Women on Monday, Davina spoke about how menopause reminded her of when she was abusing drugs.

item.title: Engineer creates the world's first real-life retractable 'Star Wars' lightsaber
item.description: Canadian James Hobson, known as 'the Hacksmith', has a following of ten million subscribers and works on turning popular science fiction items into a reality.

item.title: Size 34 teacher who lost 16st now crowdfunding for a £10k operation to remove 28lbs of excess skin
item.description: Sue Drummie, 38, of Bromley, Kent, dropped 12 dress sizes after having gastric bypass surgery in April 2019, and hopes to raise enough money to pay for an operation to remove her excess skin.

item.title: Woman, 23, developed an eating disorder after school bullies called her a 'whale'
item.description: Emma Rose Doherty, 23, from Bath, Somerset, would hide away from the world as a teenager because she was ashamed of how she looked - developing anxiety in the process.

item.title: Trump wants to come face-to-face with Biden Eric Trump says after president refused virtual debate
item.description: Eric Trump defended his father's decision to drop out of the second debate after the commission decided to change the format to virtual in light of the president's positive coronavirus diagnosis.

item.title: Heart-stopping moment careless biker rides out from behind stationary lorry and gets BATTERED by van
item.description: The footage, taken on a dash camera, shows a young boy speeding between stationary traffic on a bike outside Oval Tube station, London.

item.title: John Cleese brands late Monty Python co-star Graham Chapman a 'FANTASIST'
item.description: John Cleese has branded his late Monty Python co-star Graham Chapman a fantasist who was convinced his friends were swindling him.

item.title: Bin Laden's spokesman is 'freed from US jail term' to return to the UK because of 'Covid risk'
item.description: Osama bin Laden's London spokesman Adel Abdel Bary has been freed from a US jail to return to Britain on compassionate grounds - because he at risk from coronavirus over his obesity

item.title: Hong Kong fashion empire heiress Bonnie Evita Law dies during 'illegal' liposuction and boob job
item.description: Bonnie Evita Law, the heiress of Hong Kong clothing brand Bossini, died in January after falling into a coma during plastic surgery in Seoul. Police have released new details of the case.

item.title: 'Tasteless' homeowners are slammed over 'Grey Plague' trend
item.description: A number of examples have been shared online in recent weeks, showing how once picturesque white houses, often dating back centuries, have been transformed into ugly, grey mountains.

item.title: Road rage killer Kenny Noye, rekindles close friendship with old flame glamorous businesswoman
item.description: Double killer Noye has struck up a close friendship with mother-of-three Karen Bricker-Jones. since his release from jail for the M25 road rage murder of Stephen Cameron, 21, in 1996.

item.title: Three thugs who took turns punching and kicking London Tube passenger jailed
item.description: Lee Singleton, 27, Joseph Isaacs, 23, and Darren Cessford, 27, launched the attack on George Vartsakis at Liverpool Street Underground Station. Jamie Singleton (left) will be sentenced this week.

item.title: Marks & Spencer are selling chip shop scraps for £1.05
item.description: Shoppers can get an upmarket version of the chip shop treat as Marks & Spencer are selling tubs of scraps for £1.05 across the UK. Most chip shops offer scraps for free.

item.title: Five-bedroom cottage with own private ISLAND and moorings on River Ouse could be yours for £850,000
item.description: Creek House sits on the banks of the River Ouse in Cambridgeshire and has 90ft of river frontage and a boat mooring. Opposite is a small island (pictured) in the river which the new owner can access by boat.

item.title: Social media mocks 'uneducated' outrage over Israeli Gal Gadot being cast as Cleopatra
item.description: Israeli actress Gal Gadot has been slammed on social media after she was cast to play Cleopatra in the upcoming historical epic about the iconic Egyptian queen.

item.title: Funny cat moment: Feline gets escorted off a train after being caught on board 'without a ticket'
item.description: The feline, believed to be a stray, sneaked onto a high-speed train in China yesterday, seemingly trying to hitch a free ride. Viral footage shows it being carried off the train by a railway worker.

item.title: Mother carrying baby in car seat trips but keeps protective hand on child to stop him being hurt
item.description: In the footage, the woman exits her home in the US carrying her son Declan in his car seat in one hand and a diaper bag in the other in footage captured on a doorbell camera on October 2.

item.title: Lidl is UK's CHEAPEST supermarket
item.description: The study by trade magazine The Grocer compared a shopping basket of 33 typical grocery items among six chains - Lidl, Asda, Tesco, Morrisons, Sainsbury's and Waitrose.

item.title: UK records highest Sunday Covid hospital death toll since June
item.description: Britain has recorded a further 12,872 coronavirus cases today in a nine per cent increase on last week as the country's daily total stays above the 10,000 mark for seven-days straight.

item.title: Malcolm X secretly met the Ku Klux Klan in 1961, new book reveals
item.description: The civil rights leader met the racist Klansmen at a secret summit in Atlanta where they discussed their shared opposition to racial integration, it is claimed.
item.media:credit: The LIFE Images Collection via G

item.title: Carlo Acutis: British computer whizz is beatified in cathedral in Italy
item.description: Carlo Acutis, a British-born Italian computer whizz who used his skills to spread the Catholic faith, was beatified during a ceremony at the Basilica of San Francesco d'Assisi on Saturday.

item.title: Pet owners reveal the panic-inducing moments that had them doing a double take
item.description: Social media users from around the world shared the amusing photographs capturing the times their beloved animals unintentionally sent them into panic mode, reported Bored Panda.

item.title: British grandmother, 41, fights for life after collapsing with mystery illness during trip to Turkey
item.description: Michaela Heathcote, a single mother from Gateshead, is lying unconscious in hospital after she was denied a flight home from Dalaman in Turkey due to a high temperature in September.

item.title: Twitter flags Trump's tweet as 'misleading' after president claims he is 'immune' from coronavirus
item.description: Twitter flagged one of President Donald Trump's tweets Sunday as 'misleading' and violating its rules regarding coronavirus after he claimed he was immune to the disease.

item.title: Bill Gates says Donald Trump is wrong to call Regeneron's monoclonal antibodies 'a cure'
item.description: Bill Gates said Donald Trump is wrong to call monoclonal antibodies treatment a 'cure' for COVID-19 in an interview with NBC's Meet The Press on Sunday.
